cab.content:
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.)
G.T.5813
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 27th SEPTEMBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front. On the SENSEE battle front our troops are reported to hold BEAUCAMP, RIBECOURT, PREMY CHAPEL,(S. of the BOIS DES NEUF,) ANNEUX, BOURLON WOOD, FARM DES LILAS on the main road S.W. of HAYNECOURT.
A pocket of the enemy are reported to be still holding out in GRAINCOURT. About 5,000 prisoners and some guns have been captured.
French Front. On the ARGONNE battle front the Americans are reported to have taken VILOSNES and BRIEULLES. Over 16,000 prisoners have been taken so far.
Otherwise there is nothing to report.
2. MACEDONIAN FRONT.
British troops preceded by Yeomanry entered STRUMITZA yesterday morning, while Anglo-Greek troops on the right stormed the heights of the BELASHITSA mountains N. of Lake DOIRAN. The British have taken over 30 guns and much ammunition. Serbian cavalry have entered KOCHANE. The Serbians have taken the heights of BELI KAMEN, N. of DEMIR KAPU and also the mountain BEGOSLOBATZ.
Numbers of prisoners and enormous quantities of material continue to be captured.
ITALIAN AND PALESTINE FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
27th September, 1918.
Issued at 6.30 p.m.
